page.title: 13QUARRYING ON THE S.DOWNS
page.content: The only active quarry in this block is the large chalk quarry on the N.face of the Downs at Cocking (sq.1). Here blasting is regularly carried out, revealing a large face of white chalk eastward along the downs towards Heyshott. Access to the top of the quarry is restricted. There is a large disused quarry about 2.5 kms E.of Cocking chalk pit along the face of Heyshott Down. This is part of Heyshott Conservation area where many rare wild orchids & other plants are preserved. A small disused quarry is S.of Broadham House (sq.9). A disused marl pit lies just S.of the S.Downs Way opposite the entrance to Cocking quarry (sq.1), & another just N.of Broadham House. Names on the map indicate where former quarries have been. Stonepit bottom (sq.8), Limekiln bottom & Marlpit brow.
